description: I have found a specimen of Salvia rosmarinus, in the area of the Tagus mouth Natural Park, in Portugal. It was a very large specimen, as it was in a humid area.

While exploring Uyluk Hill in Turkey, I came across a beautiful specimen of Tulipa gesneriana. The plant had a tall, slender stem with a large, cup-shaped flower at the top, which was about 12 centimeters in diameter. The flower had vibrant red petals with a distinct yellow and black center, which contrasted beautifully with the green foliage. The plant was growing in a rocky, dry area, surrounded by other wildflowers. It was a stunning sight and a true testament to the resilience of this species in harsh environments.
